Class TilePuzzleTester

java.lang.Object
  junit.framework.Assert
      junit.framework.TestCase
          TilePuzzleTester
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class TilePuzzleTester
extends junit.framework.TestCase

A JUnit test case class. Every method starting with the word "test" will be called when running the test with JUnit.

Constructor Summary
TilePuzzleTester()
           
 
Method Summary
 void testConstructor()
          To test the constructor and the integrity of it's getGrid method.
 void testequalsFalse()
          Similar to the above test for equals, except in this case the grids are not equal in terms of elements in array.
 void testequalsFalseDimensions()
          A bit different this time for the equals method, this tests to see if the grids are equals when the elements are similar, but the grid dimensions are different.
 void testequalsTrue()
          To examine if two grids in two different TilePuzzles are equals.
 void testgetGrid()
          A test for getGrid, that tests if an array has been correctly passed to the TilePuzzle.
 void testhasWonFalse()
          Another test for the hasWon method, for an unsolved combination.
 void testhasWonTrick()
          This test for hasWon contains an array that looks like it's solved, but the last two numbers do not follow sequencial order, in that the last one is 1 above the estimated maximum (so if the grid had a max tile value of 8, this tile would be 9).
 void testhasWonTrue()
          Testing the hasWon method with a winning combination.
 void testmaxTileValue()
          A test for maxTileValue that monitors if the greatest value in the grid, which in this case is 8, returns exactly that.
 void testmaxTileValueRandom()
          Another test for maxTileValue, this time the grid is a bit randomized so that the greatest value occurs first.
 void testmoveTileDown()
          Another test to see if a tile can move downwards, using moveTile.
 void testmoveTileInvalid()
          A different test of moveTile, checks to see if an invalid move cannot be completed.
 void testmoveTileLeft()
          Yet another test for the moveTile method, this time the blank tile is to the left.
 void testmoveTileRight()
          Finally, a test with the moveTile method to see if the inputted tile can occupy the blank tile to it's right.
 void testmoveTileUp()
          To see whether a tile can occupy the blank space that is directly above it, using the moveTile method.
 void testnumTileMoves()
          A simple test for numTileMoves.
 void testnumTileMovesNone()
          Another test for numTileMoves, this time testing if no moves will register 0.
 void testtoString()
          A test for toString.
 void testtoStringComplex()
          Another test for toString.
 void testtoStringModded()
          A final test for toString, that has been modified by moveTile.

Constructor Detail

TilePuzzleTester

public TilePuzzleTester()
Method Detail

testConstructor

public void testConstructor()
To test the constructor and the integrity of it's getGrid method.

testmoveTileUp

public void testmoveTileUp()
To see whether a tile can occupy the blank space that is directly above it, using the moveTile method. Also tests the integrity of the equals method.

testmoveTileDown

public void testmoveTileDown()
Another test to see if a tile can move downwards, using moveTile.

testmoveTileLeft

public void testmoveTileLeft()
Yet another test for the moveTile method, this time the blank tile is to the left.

testmoveTileRight

public void testmoveTileRight()
Finally, a test with the moveTile method to see if the inputted tile can occupy the blank tile to it's right.

testmoveTileInvalid

public void testmoveTileInvalid()
A different test of moveTile, checks to see if an invalid move cannot be completed.

testhasWonTrue

public void testhasWonTrue()
Testing the hasWon method with a winning combination.

testhasWonFalse

public void testhasWonFalse()
Another test for the hasWon method, for an unsolved combination.

testhasWonTrick

public void testhasWonTrick()
This test for hasWon contains an array that looks like it's solved, but the last two numbers do not follow sequencial order, in that the last one is 1 above the estimated maximum (so if the grid had a max tile value of 8, this tile would be 9).

testnumTileMoves

public void testnumTileMoves()
A simple test for numTileMoves. Tests if two moves will return two.

testnumTileMovesNone

public void testnumTileMovesNone()
Another test for numTileMoves, this time testing if no moves will register 0.

testmaxTileValue

public void testmaxTileValue()
A test for maxTileValue that monitors if the greatest value in the grid, which in this case is 8, returns exactly that.

testmaxTileValueRandom

public void testmaxTileValueRandom()
Another test for maxTileValue, this time the grid is a bit randomized so that the greatest value occurs first.

testgetGrid

public void testgetGrid()
A test for getGrid, that tests if an array has been correctly passed to the TilePuzzle.

testequalsTrue

public void testequalsTrue()
To examine if two grids in two different TilePuzzles are equals. This is also an inheriently test for the getGrid method. This particular test is to see if the grids are equal, which they are.

testequalsFalse

public void testequalsFalse()
Similar to the above test for equals, except in this case the grids are not equal in terms of elements in array.

testequalsFalseDimensions

public void testequalsFalseDimensions()
A bit different this time for the equals method, this tests to see if the grids are equals when the elements are similar, but the grid dimensions are different. Hypothetically, they aren't equal.

testtoString

public void testtoString()
A test for toString. It tests to see if the grid outputted is similar to the hypothetical results, as a String.

testtoStringComplex

public void testtoStringComplex()
Another test for toString. The grid is of 1XN format.

testtoStringModded

public void testtoStringModded()
A final test for toString, that has been modified by moveTile.
